title: Figma Launches AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless In-Canvas Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma introduced three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—on December 10, 2025, enabling precise edits directly on the canvas without exporting to external apps like Photoshop.These tools integrate into a revamped contextual toolbar alongside existing features such as Remove background and Crop, prioritizing high-usage functions for efficiency.Available immediately in Figma Design and Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, they aim to streamline workflows for designers, marketers, and product teams.

paragraphs.content: The tools eliminate platform-switching friction, allowing users to remove unwanted elements, separate subjects for effects like blur or shadow adjustments, and extend backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion.Figma positions these updates as closing loops on multi-tool processes, powering complete creative workflows from generation to refinement.Expansion to other Figma products is planned for 2026, enhancing accessibility across the platform.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase Object, Isolate Object, and Expand Image Capabilities

paragraphs.content: **Erase object** uses an improved lasso tool to select and remove unwanted elements, ideal for cleaning up images in mockups without external software.**Isolate object** enables selection of subjects for repositioning or applying effects such as lighting, desaturation, shadow, color, or focus, while preserving original background traits.These prompt-free AI features provide granular control directly in Figma, reducing tedious manual adjustments.

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** extends backgrounds to fit new formats like landscape banners from square shots, maintaining visual integrity for web, social, or device adaptations.The centralized toolbar collates all edits, with Remove background prominently placed due to its popularity among users.Release notes confirm these tools support real-time refinements in grids or layouts, such as parallax effects.

sections.title: Competitive Edge and Workflow Transformations for Design Teams

paragraphs.content: Figma is catching up to Adobe and Canva's long-standing object removal features, per industry analysis, by embedding precise editing to minimize export hassles.ContentGrip highlights benefits for marketers, including faster test variations and in-house tweaks during cross-functional reviews.TechCrunch notes the launch coincided with Adobe's ChatGPT integrations, where Figma was an October partner.

These tools foster design-stage optimization, cutting back-and-forth on assets for campaigns and UI prototypes.Figma's blog describes them as making editing "faster, cleaner, and more intuitive," with 2026 rollout promising broader adoption.Tutorials demonstrate combinations like Isolate with Remove background for advanced effects, signaling a shift toward full-stack visual hubs.
